citations.narrative:
Four cavalier puppies born on 2/5/25 were shipped 3/31/25, two days prior to the required 8 week minimum age
requirement. Puppies younger than 8 weeks of age are more susceptible to stresses that occur from travelling and being
placed into a new facility. Their immune systems are more susceptible to becoming compromised which could cause
them to become sick and even die. The licensee must not sell and transport any puppies under 8 weeks of age. Correct
starting on 7/17/25.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Multiple enclosures appeared to have more than a days worth of feces buildup. I asked the facility representative when
the enclosures were last cleaned. She stated they were last cleaned two days prior. Not removing the excreta and food
waste from the enclosures daily can attract pests such as flies. In addition it can contribute to the spread of disease.
Excreta and food waste must be removed from the enclosures daily or as often as necessary to prevent an excessive
accumulation of feces and food waste. Correct starting on 7/17/25.

The licensee believes all the adult dogs in the kennel are up to date on their vaccines, but no distemper/parvo vaccine
has been documented for at least three dogs (named Lucky, Sammy, and Evelyn). Not having documentation of all
vaccines for all dogs doesn't ensure that the dogs are adequately protected from the diseases that the vaccine is
supposed to protect against. The licensee must accurately document all vaccines given to all dogs in a timely manner
moving forward. Correct by 7/18/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. End of report.
n

narrative:
2.130 
   
Minimum age requirements. 
Four cavalier puppies born on 2/5/25 were shipped 3/31/25, two days prior to the required 8 week minimum age 
requirement. Puppies younger than 8 weeks of age are more susceptible to stresses that occur from travelling and being 
placed into a new facility. Their immune systems are more susceptible to becoming compromised which could cause 
them to become sick and even die. The licensee must not sell and transport any puppies under 8 weeks of age. Correct 
starting on 7/17/25. 
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Multiple enclosures appeared to have more than a days worth of feces buildup. I asked the facility representative when 
the enclosures were last cleaned. She stated they were last cleaned two days prior. Not removing the excreta and food 
waste from the enclosures daily can attract pests such as flies. In addition it can contribute to the spread of disease. 
Excreta and food waste must be removed from the enclosures daily or as often as necessary to prevent an excessive 
accumulation of feces and food waste. Correct starting on 7/17/25. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee believes all the adult dogs in the kennel are up to date on their vaccines, but no distemper/parvo vaccine 
has been documented for at least three dogs (named Lucky, Sammy, and Evelyn). Not having documentation of all 
vaccines for all dogs doesn't ensure that the dogs are adequately protected from the diseases that the vaccine is 
supposed to protect against. The licensee must accurately document all vaccines given to all dogs in a timely manner 
moving forward. Correct by 7/18/25. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. End of report. 
 
 n
